name: Anonymous
story: Mom of 3, hardworking w/a hardworking husband as well. We don't make a livable wage even on full time! Housing, Electric, nessesities, etc takes over and when everything is paid there is nothing left for food budget. It's a higher housing market with min wage where we live

name: Donna
story: I started coming to the food pantry when my son got cancer. We had a lot of medical bills trying to them living on Social Security. If we didn't get this extra gelp I don't know what we would do. It helps out enormously I know we got toilet paper one time I tought Jade won the lottery. Little things we get mean a lot. Thank you so much !!

name: Anonymous
story: Food Bank always helps me when I'm down. Just got home from Ogden where I broke my ankle, trying to catch up with rent, and this bank is awesome

name: Anonymous
story: I live on social security and am raising a grandson and helping his mother. It's kind of tite. Thank goodness for those who share

name: Anonymous
story: It helps me becuase I have a hard time going to the store. I appreciate being able to come here

name: Anonymous
story: I came to the pantry becuase I am on limited income, social security and handicapped. Thank you so much

name: Anonymous
story: I am a single man living on social security as my only income. And I need help to make it month to month

name: Anonymous
story: In 2020 like many families we lost everything and relocated to sanpete county. Since then we have managed to get us a home (we were already homeless for a year prior to 2020). We've done amazing strides thanks to this amazing community helping us. May of 2022 my son was run over, if it wasn't for the food bank all these months we would have starved

name: Anonymous
story: The people do a great job at the food pantry. That's why I keep going here, Thank You

name: Anonymous
story: The pantry has blessed oour family so much. Trying to figure out groceries is very stressful and I am grateful to know I am not on my own and my family isn't going without. Thank You!

name: Anonymous
story: We have a single parent working after the other one got laid off. The food bank has helped us lots to feed our family

name: Anonymous
story: Hello, I'm coming to the food bank because when the pandemic happened, I decided to take care of my 2 year old child and 7 month old child so they were better. The food pantry is helping me out a lot because only me and my husband are employed and we're seven people at my home

name: Anonymous
story: This was first year at food bank I am retired/disabled and my fixed income was just enough to make ends meet. However this year ends stopped meeting and choices to pay for medical utilites and food became an issue! With food help I'm able to negotiate the rest for now but like many times are getting harder daily

name: Anonymous
story: Divorce, Business, Medical Expenses, Illness, Children, Girlfriend, Auto Maintenance, Taxes, Legal fees, Poor wages, Tired + Pissed. Thank you for your help. We appreciate you!

name: Anonymous
story: Help us now that my husband is ill. He is unable to help much. So it really helps me in my daily cooking. Lots of help. Really appreciate the food bank

name: Anonymous
story: We have been so grateful for the pantry. My family has been struggling since my son had a terrible accident out of state and was not covered by insurance. Gratefully he is doing ok now, but the medical bills are overwhelming, leaving little money each month for essentials

name: Ellie Hansen
story: Food Pantry sure helped us we just have our Social Security, The grocery are sho high and getting higher, so thankful for the blessed help. Thank you so much

name: Anonymous
story: I am 86 years old. I worked at different stores and places. Started at 17 and worked until 74. I am only making 600 dollars a month
